page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Mr Pickles has a farm on Whitworth Road.He has lived in Rochdale on Pickles farm all his life (61 years). He owns twelve and half acres of land.He has four cows,lots of calves,a pig and twelve hens.After the cows have been milked Mr Pickles feeds the milk to the calves.The farm is on the opposite side of the road to the fields where the cows used to graze and they used to have to stop the traffic whilst the cows crossed the road to be milked. Barratts have now built houses and a school (see page 7-Thrum Hall) and used a lot of the land ,and there is no longer enough acreage for him to have his own milk round.Mr Pickles does not like the parking in Rochdale and he does not like the climate;he prefers Clitheroe and places like that.
